page.title: 03Visiting Hutton-le Hole Area
page.content: Many tourists to the area also bring many cars. Parking is allowed on any available space except in Hutton-le- Hole where it is restricted to a small area at one end of the village and an excellent car park built by the North Yorks.County Council and designed also for picnickers. On good days many of the visitors sit and picnic on the green or walk round the village and children play in the beck.Other sites near streams in the area are also popular. The large number of public footpaths get only occasional use. Several times in the summer local brass bands play on the green. Produce stalls in aid of several charities are organized by villagers. Caravans are restricted. The village Inn is allowed to take up to 5 vans for not more than 3 nights and rallies are held in a near-by field.
